permissions.lbac-warning-rule: Warning: This team might not have permission to the query the datasource.
permissions.lbac-warning-team: Warning: This team has full data access if no LBAC rules are set.

action-bar.content-disable-button: Disable will disable Grafana to not use SAML auth.

assertion-mapping-unconnected.assertionAttributeExternalUid-tooltip-ex: External UID mapping is a security mechanism that prevents impersonation and it is required only when SCIM provisioning is enabled. The provisioned External UID (the identity provider generated user id) needs to be present in the SAML assertion when the user logs in. The default value for this field is userUID.
assertion-mapping-unconnected.description-allowed-organizations: List of comma- or space-separated SAML organization names. User should be a member of at least one organization to log in.
assertion-mapping-unconnected.description-assertion-attributes-mapping: Map SAML assertion attributes to the Grafana user attributes. Assertion attributes support template mappings. Team sync is available if groups attribute is configured.
assertion-mapping-unconnected.description-azure-ad-service-account-con: If you have users that belong to more than 150 groups in your Azure AD organization, you need to setup a service account in Azure AD to get all the groups via Graph API. This service account will be used to get all the groups for the user. Read more about Azure AD service account configuration in the <1>documentation</1>.
assertion-mapping-unconnected.description-force-use-graph-api: Force the use of Graph API to get all the groups for the user.
assertion-mapping-unconnected.description-name-identifier-format: Name identifier formats control how the users at identity provider are mapped to users in Grafana
assertion-mapping-unconnected.description-prevent-synchronizing-users-: Prevent synchronizing for SAML users organization roles from your IdP.
assertion-mapping-unconnected.tooltip-assertion-attributes-mapping: Assertion attributes mapping in Grafana takes user information from a SAML response and uses it to create or update a user in its database. It reads attributes—key/value pairs—within the assertion, such as Name, Login handle, and email. Configurations allow for key selection modification.
assertion-mapping-unconnected.tooltip-org-mapping: Organization mapping allows you to assign users to particular organization in Grafana depending on attribute value obtained from identity provider. Use the configuration to assign users from your organization to the Grafana organization.
assertion-mapping-unconnected.tooltip-role-mapping: Role mapping syncs user roles from your identity provider to Grafana by configuring role attributes for None, Viewer, Editor, Admin, and Grafana Admin roles. In case there is no match, the default role in Grafana is Viewer.

config-action.confirm-modal-body: Are you sure you want to permanently delete this SAML configuration? All changes made in the UI will be removed.

connect-to-idp-unconnected.configure-assertions-group-mappings: Configure assertions, group, group and org mappings in the next step.
connect-to-idp-unconnected.description-assertion-consumer-service-u: Assertion consumer service POST binding URL
connect-to-idp-unconnected.description-idp-metadata: Must be the same as set-up or required by IdP.
connect-to-idp-unconnected.description-setup-idp: To configure your identity provider (IdP) you will need the Grafana metadata URL. All below endpoints must be reachable by your Identity Provider (IdP).
connect-to-idp-unconnected.description-setup-required: Visit your IdP's configuration panel, add new app and use metadata from step one to connect with Grafana. You will need to copy your IdP's metadata and provide it below. Test connection and copy assertion labels/values.
connect-to-idp-unconnected.description-slo-url: Logout service redirect binding URL / Logout service POST binding URL
connect-to-idp-unconnected.description-sp-metadata-url-entity-id: SP metadata URL / SP Entity ID
connect-to-idp-unconnected.description-test-connection: If you want to test the connection from your IdP's panel make sure to allow IdP initiated login and provide the relay state information.
connect-to-idp-unconnected.finish-configuring-grafana-using-idp-dat: Finish configuring Grafana using IdP data

general-unconnected.description-allow-signup: Whether to allow new Grafana user creation through SAML login. If not enabled, then only existing Grafana users can log in with SAML.
general-unconnected.description-auto-login: Attempt to log in with SAML automatically, skipping the login screen.
general-unconnected.description-display-name-for-this-saml-i: Helpful if you use more than one SSO IdP provider or protocol.
general-unconnected.description-duration-grafana-metadata-va: Duration, for how long Grafana metadata is valid.
general-unconnected.description-entity-id: The entity ID is a globally unique identifier for the service provider. It is used to identify the service provider to the identity provider. Defaults to the URL of the Grafana instance.
general-unconnected.description-identity-provider-initiated-: Allows users to log in into Grafana directly from identity provider.
general-unconnected.description-max-issue-delay: Duration, since the IdP issued a response and Grafana is allowed to process it.
general-unconnected.description-relay-state: Required. Should match relay state configured in IdP and trailing space is required.
general-unconnected.description-single-logout: Allows users to log out from IdP session and applications associated with the current IdP session established via SAML.
general-unconnected.label-display-name-for-this-saml-integra: Display name for this SAML 2.0 integration

key-cert-drawer-unconnected.description-number-generated-certificate: Number of days the generated certificate is valid for.
key-cert-drawer-unconnected.subtitle-saml-key-and-certificate: The following data will be included in the generated certificate
key-cert-drawer-unconnected.tooltip-generate-the-certificate-and-pri: Generate the certificate and private key

key-cert-unconnected.description-path-to-the-grafana-private-: Path to the Grafana private key
key-cert-unconnected.description-path-to-the-grafana-x-certif: Path to the Grafana X.509 certificate
key-cert-unconnected.description-signature-algorithm: Signature algorithm used for signing requests to the IdP. Must be the same as set-up or required by IdP.
key-cert-unconnected.description-signing-and-encryption-key-c: Certificate and private key for exchanging information between the Grafana and the IdP. The private key needs to be issued in a PKCS#8 format. Certificate should be valid X.509 certificate.
key-cert-unconnected.label-signing-and-encryption-key-certifi: Signing and encryption key and certificate

save-and-test-unconnected.text-save-and-enable: If you are ready to apply your SAML configuration use the “Save and enable” button. You will be able to disable the configuration.

end.description: If no end date is selected, the banner is displayed indefinitely.
end.error: End time must be after start time
end.label: Ends at

message.description: Text content of the banner. Supports markdown.
message.label: Message

start.description: The banner will be shown starting from this date/time.
start.label: Starts at

message.default: Update this preview by modifying the message field.

readonly.message: This data source was added by config and caching cannot be modified using the UI. Please contact your server admin to update this data source.
readonly.title: Provisioned data source

cache-clean.body-clear-cache: Warning: This action impacts all cache-enabled data sources. If you are using Memcached, the system clears all data from the Memcached instance. Do you want to continue?

cache-cta.protip-caching-cannot-enabled-source: This data source's configuration does not permit caching to be enabled.
cache-cta.protip-caching-not-enabled: Enabling caching can reduce the amount of redundant requests sent to the data source.
cache-cta.title-caching-cannot-enabled-source: Caching cannot be enabled for this data source.
cache-cta.title-caching-not-enabled: Caching is not enabled for this data source.

cache-settings-form.description-query-ttl: The time-to-live for a query cache item in milliseconds. Example: 5000
cache-settings-form.description-resource-ttl: Resources are dynamic values that Grafana data source plugins retrieve from data sources for use in the query editor. Examples are Splunk namespaces, Prometheus labels, and CloudWatch metric names. Since these values update less frequently, you might prefer a longer cache TTL for Resources than queries. See the <2>docs</2> for more info.
cache-settings-form.description-timetolive-resources-cache-i: The time-to-live for resources cache items in milliseconds. Example: 5000
cache-settings-form.description-use-default-ttl: Enable this to use the default TTL set in Grafana's configuration ({{defaultTTLMs}} ms)

data-source-cache.query-catching: Enable query caching for free during your trial of Grafana Pro.
data-source-cache.upgrade-content-author-dashboards: Author dashboards more smoothly by caching the data used to construct queries, like fields in ServiceNow or metrics available from Datadog
data-source-cache.upgrade-content-description: With query caching, you can load dashboards faster and reduce costly queries to data sources by temporarily storing query results in memory, Redis, or Memcached.
data-source-cache.upgrade-content-load-dashboards: Load dashboards in less than a second from the cache, even when they include big queries and lots of users are looking at once
data-source-cache.upgrade-content-save-money: Save money and avoid rate limiting by reducing the number of API calls you make to data sources like Splunk, CloudWatch and Github

query-library.query-template-add-error: Error attempting to save this query to the library
query-library.query-template-added: Query successfully saved to the library
query-library.query-template-edit-error: Error attempting to edit this query

query-template-modal.add-info: You're about to save this query. Once saved, you can easily access it from the query library for future use and reference.
query-template-modal.edit-info: You're about to edit this query. Once saved, you can easily access it from the query library for future use and reference.
query-template-modal.title: Title

pdf.info-text: Export the dashboard as a PDF document
pdf.title: Export dashboard PDF
pdf.zoom-description: Zoom in to enlarge text, or zoom out to see more data (like table columns) per panel.

empty-state.pro-tip: Want to manage Grafana access through groups in your Identity Provider? Create group mappings to Grafana RBAC roles. <2>Learn more</2>
empty-state.title: You haven't created any group mappings yet

group-sync-editor.body-delete-group-mappings: Are you sure you want to delete all mappings for this group?
group-sync-editor.text-deprecated-feature: This feature is deprecated and your rules will stop working in June 2025. Please migrate to external group sync in the desired team's settings and assign roles to teams.

expires-soon.sub-title-license-expiration_one: {{count}} day remaining, after which <3>Enterprise features will be disabled.</3>
expires-soon.sub-title-license-expiration_other: {{count}} days remaining, after which <3>Enterprise features will be disabled.</3>
expires-soon.title-grafana-enterprise-license-expire: Your Grafana Enterprise license will expire soon

has-expired.title-your-grafana-enterprise-license-ha: Your Grafana Enterprise license has expired

is-invalid.title-your-grafana-enterprise-license-is: Your Grafana Enterprise license is invalid

license-info.aria-label-details-about-license-grafana: View details about your license in Grafana Cloud
license-info.card-content-anonymous-users-tooltip_one: For every {{count}} anonymous device, Grafana counts 1 user.
license-info.card-content-anonymous-users-tooltip_oth: For every {{count}} anonymous devices, Grafana counts 1 user.
license-info.card-content-license-expires-tooltip: The license expiration date is the date when the current license is no longer active. As the license expiration date approaches, Grafana Enterprise displays a banner.
license-info.card-content-token-auto-update: Grafana automatically updates the token before it expires. If your token is not updating, contact support.
license-info.card-content-url-tooltip: License URL is the root URL of your Grafana instance. The license will not work on an instance of Grafana with a different root URL.
license-info.card-content-usage-billing-tooltip: You can request Grafana Labs to turn on usage billing to allow an unlimited number of active users. When usage billing is enabled, Grafana does not enforce active user limits or display warning banners. Instead, you are charged for active users above the limit, according to your customer contract.
license-info.edition-notice-licensing-info: You are running Grafana Enterprise without a license. The Enterprise features are disabled.
license-info.edition-notice-problem-licensing-info: There is a problem with your Enterprise license token. The Enterprise features are disabled.
license-info.license-alert: License token uploaded. Restart Grafana for the changes to take effect.
license-info.title-contact-support-renew-token-visit-: Contact support to renew your token, or visit the Cloud portal to learn more.
license-info.utilization-footer: Utilization of licenced users is determined based on signed-in users' activity in the past 30 days.
license-info.utilization-info: Read about <2>active user limits</2> and <6>concurrent session limits</6>.

max-users-reached.title-exceeded-included-number-active-us: You have exceeded the included number of active users
max-users-reached.upgrade-your-license-subtitle_one: Your Grafana Enterprise license includes {{maxUsers}} active users; you currently have {{count}} active user.
max-users-reached.upgrade-your-license-subtitle_other: Your Grafana Enterprise license includes {{maxUsers}} active users; you currently have {{count}} active users.

token-expires-soon.sub-title-token-expiration_one: Your license token has {{count}} day remaining, after which <4>Enterprise features will be disabled.</4>
token-expires-soon.sub-title-token-expiration_other: Your license token has {{count}} days remaining, after which <4>Enterprise features will be disabled.</4>
token-expires-soon.title-grafana-enterprise-token-needs-ren: Your Grafana Enterprise token needs to be renewed

analytics-drawer.text-access-usage-insights-during-trial-: Get full access to usage insights for free during your trial of Grafana Pro.

analytics-upgrade-drawer.description-usage-insights-provide-detai: Usage Insights provide detailed information about dashboard usage, like the number of views, queries, and errors users have experienced. You can use this to improve users’ experience and troubleshoot issues.

data-source-insights.available-source: No available data for this data source.
data-source-insights.text-enable-source-usage-insights-during: Enable data source usage insights for free during your trial of Grafana Pro.
data-source-insights.text-feature-not-available-expired-licen: Data source insights are not available with an expired license. Data will continue to be collected but you need to update your license to see this page.
data-source-insights.title-feature-available-expired-license: Feature not available with an expired license

data-source-insights-upgrade.clean-instance-list-item: Clean up your instance by finding and removing unused data sources
data-source-insights-upgrade.demonstrate-and-improve-list-item: Demonstrate and improve the value of your observability service by keeping track of user engagement
data-source-insights-upgrade.description-usage-insights-provide-detai: Usage Insights provide detailed information about data source usage, like the number of views, queries, and errors users have experienced. You can use this to improve users’ experience and troubleshoot issues
data-source-insights-upgrade.keep-performant-list-item: Keep Grafana performant by identifying and fixing slow, error-prone data sources
data-source-insights-upgrade.review-insights-list-item: Review individual data source usage insights at a glance in the UI, sort search results by usage and errors, or dig into detailed usage logs

data-source-permissions.text-enable-source-permissions-during-tr: Enable data source permissions for free during your trial of Grafana Pro.

permissions-upgrade-content.description-source-permissions-protect-s: With data source permissions, you can protect sensitive data by limiting access to this data source to specific users, teams, and roles.
permissions-upgrade-content.source-permissions-protect-clean-experie: Clean up users’ experience by hiding data sources they don’t need to use
permissions-upgrade-content.source-permissions-protect-sensitive-dat: Protect sensitive data, like security logs, production databases, and personally-identifiable information
permissions-upgrade-content.source-permissions-protect-share-access-: Share Grafana access more freely, knowing that users will not unwittingly see sensitive data

sandbox.enable-sandbox-tooltip: The frontend sandbox runs frontend code in isolation, restricting access to global browser scope and limiting UI modifications to the plugin area.

email-sharing.success-resend-recipient-invitation: The email invitation has been resent.
email-sharing.success-revoke-access-description: You have successfully revoked access for {{recipientEmail}}.
email-sharing.success-revoke-all-accesses-description: {{email}}'s access to all public dashboards has been successfully removed.
email-sharing.success-send-recipient-invitation: The email invitation has been sent.

confirm-access-page.login-subtitle: Get access to the dashboard for 30 days. After 30 days, you can request access again to continue viewing the dashboard.

create-recorded-query-unconnected.description-decide-often-record-query: Decide how often to record this query
create-recorded-query-unconnected.description-provide-a-description-for-th: Provide a description for this query
create-recorded-query-unconnected.description-select-value-template-variab: Select a value for each template variable
create-recorded-query-unconnected.query-relative-time-range: Select this query's relative time range
create-recorded-query-unconnected.success-alert-message: Your new recorded query is recording successfully!

empty-recorded-query-list.pro-tip: ProTip: You can record queries from the query editor.

recorded-queries-config-unconnected.body-delete: Are you sure you want to delete '{{name}}'?

recorded-queries-deprecation-notice.description: Recorded queries are deprecated. Please use the new <2>Grafana Managed Recording Rules</2> instead.

recorded-query-add-modal-unconnected.new-recorded-query-alert: To create a new Recorded Query, return to the query editor and use the  <2></2>  icon in the series bar.

write-target-config-unconnected.select-data-source-label: Select the data source where metrics will be written

errors.action-message: Please contact your Grafana administrator to install the plugin.
errors.no-renderer-description: To generate PDF reports, you must install the <2>Grafana Image Renderer</2> plugin.
errors.old-renderer-description: To generate CSV files, you must update the <2>Grafana Image Renderer</2> plugin.
errors.old-renderer-title: You are using an old version of the image renderer plugin

page.empty-pro-tip: Create a report from any existing dashboards. <2>Learn more</2>
page.empty-title: There are no reports created yet

schedule.frecuency-last-day-label: Send on the last day of month
schedule.frecuency-last-day-warning: Note: some months do not have a {{warningDateText}} day and reports will not be sent on those months. Choose an earlier date or <3>"Send on the last day of month"</3> to send a report at the end of each month.

settings.email-logo-url-field-description: The logo will be displayed in the email header. Supported formats: png, jpg, gif.
settings.embedded-image-theme-picker-description: The theme will be applied to the dashboard image embedded in the email.
settings.pdf-theme-picker-description: The theme will be applied to the PDF attached to the report.
settings.report-logo-url-field-description: The logo will be displayed in the document footer. Supported formats: png, jpg, gif.

all-template-alert.description-not-supported: The value All in template variables used in repeating rows or panels is not supported in PDF

title.combine-all-pdfs-in-one-file: Combine all PDFs in one file

create-report-tab.description-reporting-allows-automatical: Reporting allows you to automatically generate PDFs from any of your dashboards and have Grafana email them to interested parties on a schedule.
create-report-tab.text-create-unlimited-reports-during-tri: Create unlimited reports during your trial of Grafana Pro.

edit-actions.body-are-you-sure: Are you sure you want to delete this report?

format-report.description-enlarge-table-columns-panel: Zoom in to enlarge text, or zoom out to see more data (like table columns) per panel.
format-report.label-combine-dashboard: Combine all dashboard PDFs in one file
format-report.tooltip-download-table-panel: Download table panel data as CSVs in a ZIP file

highlight-trial-report.get-started-with-reporting-text: Reporting allows you to automatically generate PDFs from any of your dashboards and have Grafana email them to interested parties on a schedule.
highlight-trial-report.text-create-unlimited-reports-during-tri: Create unlimited reports during your trial of Grafana Pro.

report-upgrade-content.description-reporting-allows-automatical: Reporting allows you to automatically generate PDFs from any of your dashboards and have Grafana email them to interested parties on a schedule.

render-list.placeholder-search-reports-report-dashbo: Search reports by report name, dashboard name or recipients
render-list.text-create-unlimited-reports-during-tri: Create unlimited reports during your trial of Grafana Pro.

select-dashboard.description-time-range: Generate report with the data from specified time range. If custom time range is empty the time range from the report's dashboard is used.

share.description-address-appear-reply-field-e: The address that will appear in the Reply to field of the email
share.description-separate-multiple-emails-com: Separate multiple emails with a comma or semicolon.
share.email-info-button: The report name will be used as the email subject if this field is left empty
share.recipients-placeholder-recipients-email-: Type in the recipients email addresses and press Enter

unavailable-feature-info-box.title-feature-available-expired-license: Feature not available with an expired license

upgrade-report.description-reporting-allows-automatical: Reporting allows you to automatically generate PDFs from any of your dashboards and have Grafana email them to interested parties on a schedule.

attachments.combine-one-file: Combine all dashboards PDFs in one file
attachments.csv-tables: Attach a CSV file of table panel data
attachments.orientation-tooltip: The orientation selection will be applied to the dashboard PDF, table data and the PDF appendix
attachments.pdf-report: Attach the report as a PDF
attachments.pdf-tables: Attach a separate PDF of table data
attachments.pdf-tables-appendix: Include table data as PDF appendix
attachments.show-template-variables: Show template variables in the header

dashboard.repeated-template-variables-description: When adding the same dashboard multiple times in one report, template variables that you selected first are applied to all instances of that dashboard in the report.
dashboard.time-range-description: Empty time range will fallback to the time range from the report's dashboard. Absolute time range is represented in your browser's timezone.

discard-changes.text: You have unsaved changes to this dashboard report. Are you sure you want to discard them?
discard-changes.title: Discard changes to report?

email-configuration.dashboard-image-settings-description: The dashboard image settings can be adjusted in the general<1>report settings</1>
email-configuration.subject-description: The report name will be used as the email subject if this field is left empty

empty-list.description: Create a report from this dashboard. <2>Learn more</2>

recipients.tooltip: Separate multiple email addresses with a comma or semicolon

schedule.end-date-invalid: End date must be greater or equal to start date
schedule.interval-amount-min: Interval amount must be at least 2
schedule.last-day-of-month: Send on the last day of month
schedule.monthly-schedule-alert-title: Note: Reports won't be sent on months that don't have a {{ dayNumber }} day. Choose an earlier date or select "Send on the last day of the month" to send a report at the end of every month.

send-preview.email-description: Separate multiple email addresses with a comma or semicolon
send-preview.title: Send preview

unavailable-feature-info-box.message: Creating new reports is not available with an expired license. Existing reports continue to be processed but you need to update your license to create a new one.

team-lbaceditor-unconnected.add-query-permissions: <0>Add Query Permissions:</0> The following teams do not have query permissions for the data source, and are therefore not able to query logs with the configured LBAC rules.
team-lbaceditor-unconnected.add-team-lbac-rules: <0>Add Team LBAC Rules:</0> The following teams can query all logs. Please add Team LBAC rules for them:
team-lbaceditor-unconnected.description-data-access: Here you can configure access to specific data within the datasource using LogQL label selectors.
team-lbaceditor-unconnected.ensure-proper-access-control-please-foll: To ensure proper access control, please follow these recommendations:
team-lbaceditor-unconnected.filter-teams-aria-label: Filter LBAC rules by team name
team-lbaceditor-unconnected.lbac-description: Configure LBAC rules to restrict access for specific metrics/logs.
team-lbaceditor-unconnected.lbac-rules-note: Note:<1></1>- LBAC rules will NOT apply to the query if the authenticated Cloud Access Policy token has any label selectors configured in Grafana Cloud.<3></3>- Changes to LBAC rules may take up to 5 minutes to be reflected due to query path caching.
team-lbaceditor-unconnected.remove-unrestricted-access: <0>Remove Unrestricted Access:</0> The following roles currently have unrestricted access to logs.
